ThingDef.label: Empire ceiling light basic
ThingDef.description: An Empire ceiling light. Rather crude, but effective at lighting spaces. Used in work rooms, homes of the lower classes (if they can afford it), and perhaps mines.\n\nThe folk of the Empire are a rare spark of civilization in the otherwise harsh tribal world of greenskins, chaos, and skaven. Bringing light to the dark is a strong example of that civilization.

ThingDef.label: Empire ceiling light
ThingDef.description: An Empire light to hang from the ceiling. Visually appealing, and functional. Used in bedrooms, dining areas, and perhaps work rooms.\n\nThe folk of the Empire are a rare spark of civilization in the otherwise harsh tribal world of greenskins, chaos, and skaven. Bringing light to the dark is a strong example of that civilization. This fixture brings that light in abudnance.

ThingDef.label: Empire chandelier
ThingDef.description: An elaborate Empire ceiling light. It's gothic looking, and is intricate in its design. Intended to be used in the most honored rooms.\n\nEmpire elector counts and lords would have no less than this in their dining halls, meeting rooms, and perhaps even bedrooms.

ThingDef.label: Meditation Cushion
ThingDef.description: A place to meditate in comfort, will restore magic, failty, or action ability. Used by magic, faith, and ability action users.

ThingDef.label: Empire table (1x2)
ThingDef.description: A small table built in the style of the women and men of the Empire. Sturdy, good looking, and very functional.\n\nThese tables can be found in the home of any mid level or higher Empire person. Higher quality than what you'd expect in the hovel of the poor, but not nearly as large or elaborate as what you would expect of a noble.

ThingDef.label: Empire table (2x2)
ThingDef.description: A medium sized table built in the style of the women and men of the Empire. Sturdy, good looking, and very functional.\n\nThese tables can be found in the home of any mid level or higher Empire person, or even lesser lords.

ThingDef.label: Empire table (3x3)
ThingDef.description: A large sized table built in the style of the women and men of the Empire. Sturdy, good looking, and very functional.\n\nThese tables can be found in the home of any higher level Empire person, or including lords.

ThingDef.label: Empire shelf
ThingDef.description:
A shelf for storing things. Items stored in this will not affect room beauty and they won't deteriorate, even if outside.

Every castle will have a proper storage room, and these shelves are what helps make that happen.

EXTENDED STORAGE NOTE: If you're using the Extended Storage mod, this shelf will automatically have the ability to store six times more than a normal shelf can store. It can hold anything you'd like, except buildings. Make sure you set what you want it to hold, as it defaults to Raw Resources. If you are not using the Extended Storage mod, this will function like a normal shelf.

ThingDef.label: Empire cabinet
ThingDef.description:
An elaborate cabinet for storing things. Items stored in this will not affect room beauty and they won't deteriorate, even if outside.

Every lord will have a private cabinet for storing their most important possessions.

EXTENDED STORAGE NOTE: If you're using the Extended Storage mod, this shelf will automatically have the ability to store six times more than a normal shelf can store. It can hold anything you'd like, except buildings. Make sure you set what you want it to hold, as it defaults to Raw Resources. If you are not using the Extended Storage mod, this will function like a normal shelf.

ThingDef.label: Empire dresser
ThingDef.description: A dresser for a bedroom. Gives a decent comfort bonus to all nearby beds. Placing more than one dresser near the same bed has no effect.

ThingDef.label: Empire stool
ThingDef.description: A simple platform on which to sit, constructed in the style of The Empire. Not very comfortable, but much better than nothing. Can be used at tables, work stations, and elsewhere.

ThingDef.label: Empire bed
ThingDef.description: A cozy mattress and sheets on a gothic frame for the folks of the Empire to rest on.\n\nWhile most the poor sleep on the floor, any one above their station would certainly have a bed in their home.

ThingDef.label: Empire double bed
ThingDef.description: A cozy mattress and sheets on a bed frame for the folk of the Empire to rest on. Double wide, so two can sleep.\n\nGood for those in a couple, but works for a single person as well. Getting good rest when sleeping helps make the men and women of the Empire more alert, and capable of dealing with the many threats that assail them.

ThingDef.label: Empire end table
ThingDef.description: A small gothic looking bedside table which makes nearby beds a little bit more comfortable. Must be placed directly adjacent to the head of the bed. Placing more than one end table near the same bed has no effect.\n\nA place to keep their most needed items at night is necessary for everyone, women and men of the Empire not excluded.

ThingDef.label: Empire brazier
ThingDef.description: A brazier for lighting and heating area, built in the style of the Empire. People need light to move and work at full speed. Can be automatically refueled with wood or coal. Produces a good amount of heat and light.\n\nLight gives the men and women of the Empire comfort, as it keeps the dark things at bay. Heat is always welcome in a cold and drafty castle.

ThingDef.label: Empire dining chair
ThingDef.description: A comfortable and attractive human-sized chair ornamented in the style of the Empire. Can be used at tables, work stations, and elsewhere.\n\nNo lord or wealthy person in the Empire would be caught with basic chairs around; they'd hire an artisan to construct one of these comfortable and great looking chairs.

ThingDef.label: Empire royal bed
ThingDef.description: A luxurious gold-inlaid bed fit for the the lords, ladies, and heros of the Empire. Very comfortable and beautiful, it is a work of fine art. Sleeps two.\n\Empire lords, ladies, and even wealthy merchants would likely have one of these beds. Keeping order and light in the world is hard work, and a proper bed helps get the rest needed to accomplish the work; even if said bed is a bit over the top.

ThingDef.label: Empire wall light
ThingDef.description: A small enclosed metal fixture, attached to the wall for lighting an area. People need light to move and work at full speed. Can be automatically refueled with wood or animal fat. Produces no heat.\n\nGiven the importance of light to the people of the Empire,and its significance in keeping the creatures of darkness at bay, these wall lights are popular throughout Empire castles and cities. The fact that it is enclosed makes it useful for lighting outdoor spaces.

ThingDef.Name: RH_TET_Empire_WallLight_On
ThingDef.label: Wall light (On)
ThingDef.description: None.

ThingDef.Name: RH_TET_Empire_WallLightGlower
ThingDef.label: Empire wall light
ThingDef.description: A small enclosed metal fixture attached to the wall for lighting an area. Folk of the Empire need light to move, and work at full speed. Can be automatically refueled with wood or animal fat. Produces a tiny amount of heat.

ThingDef.label: Pole Light
ThingDef.description:
An enclosed metal cage on a wooden pole. Creates light, and a small amount of heat. Intended for outdoor lighting purposes. Since it's enclosed, rain or weather do not affect it. Great for lighting paths, walkways, mines, and more.

Light and order are synonymous in the Empire, and brightening up those dark old world nights grants comfort to the men and women of the Empire.

Rotating this will give you different style options.

ThingDef.label: Sign Pole Light
ThingDef.description:
A signpost, directing travelers to their destination, providing light, and marking the area as a part of the Empire of Man.

Light and order are synonymous in the Empire, and brightening up those dark old world nights grants comfort to the men and women of the Empire.

Rotating this will give you different style options.

ThingDef.label: Empire banner - Averland
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner in the colors of Averland. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire banner - Hochland
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner in the colors of Hochland. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire banner - Middenland
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner in the colors of Middenland. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire banner - Ostermark
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner in the colors of Ostermark. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire banner - Ostland
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner in the colors of Ostland. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire banner - Stirland
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner in the colors of Stirland. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire banner - Talabheim
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner in the colors of Talabheim. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire banner - Reikland
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner in the colors of Reikland. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire banner - Nordland
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner in the colors of Nordland. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire banner - Wissenland
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner in the colors of Wissenland. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire war banner
ThingDef.description: An Empire war banner depicting the glory of Ghal Maraz, and the strength of the nation. Carried to battle when the armies march to war. Kept safe when home, and has the benefit of adding beauty to a room.

ThingDef.label: Empire small wall war banner
ThingDef.description:
A war banner of the Empire of Man, intended to be hung from a wall.

Adds beauty, and sense of national pride.

This version is intended to be used on standard sized walls, both inside and outside. Rotating this object will give you different interesting options for its appearance.

ThingDef.label: Empire large wall war banner
ThingDef.description:
A war banner of the Empire of Man, intended to be hung from a wall.

Adds beauty, and sense of national pride.

This version is intended to be used on large sized walls (like the Empire Curtain Walls), outside. Rotating this object will give you different interesting options for its appearance.
